set.name: MIMCO "Moon and Back" Spring-Summer 2016 collection x Ethical Fashion Initiative
set.description:
MIMCO produced 1230 bags in two styles with 3690 component in Kenya as part of their Spring-Summer 2016 collection. 

A total of 142 artisans were involved in producing the order, part of eight different community groups: Artisan.Fashion, Kisamis Kenya, Nameni Eriroi, Olonana Women Group, Dynasty Self Help Group, Olanke Women Group, Namaiyana Women Group and Sanata Women Group. 

84% of the participants in the order were women and 87.64% were under the age of 40. 79.8% of the artisans used income received to fund the education of their children. 

The different skills required to produce the order were: beading, preparation, stitching, embroidery, screen printing and supervision.

things.name: Inkson
things.address: Inkson Industrial Co Ltd, Ground Floor, Building 7, Dunga Road, Nairobi
things.description: Ink was purchased from Inkson in Kenya, these water based inks were used to produce prints on the bags of the MIMCO Spring-Summer 2016 collection.

things.name: Nameni Eriroi to Ethical Fashion Artisans EPZLTD
Olanke Women Group
things.description: Group of women living in a very remote area of Kajiado. They walk long distances to meet in a central place in Kimuga. Their coming together was precipitated by their need to raise school fees for the education of their children particularly girls. There were 15 participants on this project, of which, 100% were women.

things.name: Thika Clothe Mill Ltd to Ethical Fashion Artisans EPZLTD
Sanata Women Group
things.description: The group was first formed largely by internally displaced women resulting from the post-election violence in 2008. It was later registered as a self-help group with the aim of improving their livelihood and further developing their skills. The Ethical Fashion Initiative has supported this group since its first order in Kenya. There were 20 participants on this project, of which 85% were women.

things.name: Olonana Women Group to Ethical Fashion Artisans EPZLTD
Dynasty Self Help Group to Ethical Fashion Artisans EPZLTD
Namaiyana Women Group
things.description: A group of women who previously used their beading and crocheting skills to be self employed. They came together with an aim of consolidating their efforts to access bigger markets.

Artisan.Fashion EPZ Ltd
things.what: Beadwork Preparation, Stitching, Screen printing, Finishing, Final quality control, Packing
things.description:
Artisan.Fashion is a social enterprise that was established in 2005 to connect Africa’s artisans to esteemed luxury brands all over the world. They are the first African production company to successfully combine artisan creativity and production capability with a careful consideration for traceable social impact. 

Acting both as a production hub and a disseminator of work, they employ Kenyan artisans in their hub and collaborate with 17 artisan communities across Kenya to produce hand crafted materials and artifacts made with traditional skills.

For more info visit: www.artisan.fashion

ARTISAN TESTIMONIAL

Miriam Mwangangi

"I am a single mother of three. I have four years experience in embroidery and really loved working on the MIMCO order. In addition to regular income I received good training during the order which has greatly improved my skills. I also learnt how to improve my working conditions and how to reduce work related stress."

things.name: Meera Smart Wear to Namaiyana women group
Oldanyati Women Group
things.description: A group of women living in the poor, rural area of Oldanyatti. It is mainly composed of Maasai women who produce beaded articles for sale. There were 15 participants working on the MIMCO "Moon and Back" Spring-Summer 2016 collection, of which, 100% were women.

things.name: YKK Kenya EPZ Ltd
things.description: Zip components (sliders, zip chain, teeth and tape) were purchased from YKK Kenya to be used for the zip closures of the bags in the "Moon and Back" Spring-Summer 2016 collection.

things.name: Olonana Women Group
things.description:
A group of women specialising in traditional Kenyan beadwork. The women work together to earn enough money to afford sanitary towels for their daughters who otherwise would drop out of school.

ARTISAN TESTIMONIAL

Maria Teteyio:

"I am a 37 year old mother of six. The MIMCO order was really important to me in terms of affording my children's school fees. Educating children in my family is not a priority for my husband and so I work hard to pay tuition fees as well as uniform, food and book costs. I do not wish to see my children lack education like I did and so the MIMCO Spring-Summer 2016 order contributed towards fulfilling my wish."

things.name: Nameni Eriroi
things.description: A group of women from the Maasai ethnic community who specialise in beadwork. They came together to share experiences in order to ease the family burdens born by women. There were 20 participants on this project, of which, 100% were women.

things.name: Meera Smart Wear to Olanke Women Group
Meera Smart Wear to Ethical Fashion Artisans EPZLTD
Thika Cloth Mills Ltd
things.description:
Cotton canvas and cotton kitenge were purchased from Thika Cloth Mills Ltd. Canvas is an extremely durable plain-woven fabric used for making sails and tents in Kenya while kitenge  is a softer fabric worn by women, often wrapped around the chest or waist, over the head as a headscarf, or as a baby sling. 

Cotton canvas was used for the construction of the bags while the cotton kitenge was used for the lining of the bags in the MIMCO "Moon and Back" Spring-Summer 2016 collection. 

For more information see Thika Clothe Mill Ltd's website: http://thikaclothmills.com

things.name: Sanata Women Group to Ethical Fashion Artisans EPZLTD
Artbeads Limited Nairobi
things.address: Art Beads, River Road, Nairobi City
things.description: Glass beads were purchased from Artbeads Limited Nairobi in Kenya,  who import them from the Czech Republic where they are seen to manufacture the best quality beads worldwide. The glass Beads were used to make the beaded circles on the bags and decorate the yip pullers in the MIMCO Spring-Summer 2016 collection.

things.name: Artbeads Limited Nairobi to Olonana Women Group
Artbeads Limited Nairobi to Nameni Eriroi
Dynasty Self Help Group
things.address: Kandisi Community Project Center, Ongata Rongai, Nairobi
things.description: A group composed of young people, with the majority under the age of 35. They came together to form a self-help group, that utlises their beadwork, crocheting and weaving skills to address the acute problem of unemployment.

things.name: Namaiyana women group to Ethical Fashion Artisans EPZLTD

Meera Smart Wear
things.address: Meera Smart Wear, Ronald Ngala Street, Nairobi
things.description: Fishing line and poly-cotton thread were purchased from Meera Smart Wear in Kenya . Fishing line is a nylon cord commonly used in Kenya for fishing and beading. The nylon and polycotton threads were used for the construction of the bags in the MIMCO "Moon and Back" Spring-Summer 2016 collection.

things.name: Sagana Tanneries Ltd
things.description: Leather from local cow hides and goat skins were purchased from Sagana Tanneries Ltd in Kenya and used for leather handles of the bags in the MIMCO "Moon and Back" Spring-Summer 2016 collection.

things.description: Upon completion, the 1,230 bags for the Spring-Summer 2017 "Moon and Back" collection were shipped to Mimco in Australia for them to deliver it to their various retail stores. The bags can also be purchased from their e-commerce store online.
